entry.title: Fuck it, we write
entry.content:
I've had this blog, on its various domains, for probably close to 10 years now. I've written quite a few articles, yet have published basically none of them. Each time I've written something, my perfectionist tendencies would repeatedly stop me just short of actually publishing and let perfect be the enemy of good enough.

Today, that ends.

I've had this horrible decades-long habit of just enduring whatever bullshit comes my way, staying silent until I can't bear it anymore. With all of the events over the past few years, this only seems to gets worse, and it's becoming increasingly clear that I can not and should not stay silent anymore. It is precisely why this site is under the no-bull.sh domain. I'm sick and tired of all of the bullshit, the willful ignorance, and the slop surrounding us, and it's due time for that frustration to find a healthy outlet.

If you've worked with me professionally in the past, these posts may very well be a bit of a shock: I will not be self-censoring myself. Close friends know I can be extremely crass, and, at times, very abrasive. For good reason, I would hope.

If this sounds like this is only a place for me to vent, I won't deny that it will have a lot of potentially unhinged rants. However, it won't be the only thing I will write about. In the coming weeks and months, I will strive to post new articles on this blog. There's already few ideas that need to be fleshed out:

  • My opinions on LLMs and the AI hype cycle.
  • Doujin culture in the United States in 2026 and beyond.
  • Digital freedom and privacy in a increasingly authoritarian world.
  • The current state of writing panic free code in Rust.
  • Collaboration on FOSS projects in a multipolar world.
  • The importance of FOSS governance.
  • Using technology to address social problems.
  • Life and death, grief and loss within the family.
  • Anti-features and the rise of techno-Ludditism.
  • The collapse of the open web.
  • ... and many more!

If you'd like to join me on this adventure and be kept up to date on my latest ramblings, I'll be broadcasting each on BlueSky and this site provides an RSS feed.
